title: Biceps Tendinopathy Management
content: Biceps tendinopathy affects the long head of the biceps tendon at the shoulder. Treatment includes activity modification, NSAIDs, and physical therapy focusing on rotator cuff and scapular stabilizer strengthening. Corticosteroid injection into the bicipital groove provides temporary relief. For refractory cases, surgical options include tenotomy or tenodesis, with choice based on patient age, activity level, and cosmetic concerns.
